revised_title: Temperature Distribution and Phenomena Encountered During the Boring of the Simplon Tunnel
tldr: The authors investigate the temperature distribution and phenomena encountered during the construction of the Simplon Tunnel, a 19,730-meter-long tunnel under the Swiss Alps. They record the temperature of the rocks and analyze the factors affecting the thermal conditions of the region, providing insights into the Earth's temperature gradient and the challenges faced during the tunneling process.
